citation.article-title: Description of Enterovibrio nigricans sp. nov., reclassification of Vibrio calviensis as Enterovibrio calviensis comb. nov. and emended description of the genus Enterovibrio Thompson et al. 2002.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Emended description of the genus Enterovibrio Thompson et al. 2002

The description is the same as that provided by Thompson et al. (2002) with the following modifications: arginine dihydrolase activity, indole production, nitrate reduction and susceptibility to the vibriostatic agent O/129 may be variable among species.
The main fatty acids are 16 : 1ω7c/iso-15 : 0 2-OH (32–50 % in known strains), 16 : 0 (15–21 %) and 18 : 1ω7c (11–23 %).
Other fatty acids detected (up to 5 %) in all species, even under different growth conditions, are 16 : 1ω9c, 18 : 1ω9c, 12 : 0, 14 : 0, 14 : 0 3-OH/iso-16 : 1 I, 12 : 0 3-OH, 18 : 0 and iso-16 : 0.
The G+C content of the DNA is 47–50 mol%.
